name: watchtower
description: Watchtower is a self-hosted automation tool that monitors running Docker containers and automatically updates them when new images are available. It operates as a background container with configuration via environment variables and CLI.
features: Automatic updates: Monitor Docker containers and automatically pull and deploy new image versions when available.
Scheduled scans: Configure update check intervals from minutes to days based on your update preferences.
Notification system: Receive alerts via email, Slack, Discord, or webhooks when containers are updated.
Rolling updates: Update containers one at a time to minimize downtime and maintain service availability.
Label-based control: Use Docker labels to include or exclude specific containers from automatic updates.
Pre/post-update hooks: Execute custom scripts before or after updates for backup or validation tasks.
Registry authentication: Support private Docker registries with credential management for enterprise deployments.
Update monitoring: Track update history and view logs of all container updates performed.
Cleanup automation: Automatically remove old Docker images after successful updates to save disk space.
Test mode: Run in monitor-only mode to see what would be updated without making actual changes.
Resource efficient: Minimal CPU and memory footprint suitable for running on resource-constrained hosts.
Multi-host support: Manage updates across multiple Docker hosts using Docker Swarm or remote API connections.
